## Introduction

The following Institutional Research (IR) project analyzes Vermont Technical College (VTC) public data between 2019 and 2020. The project is written in the open-source [R programming language](https://www.rstudio.com/) and employs advanced analytics methods to create and present data summaries, visualizations, and models from each VTC major school entity.

To see the code from each data set, report, or visualization click the `CODE` button on the right in its respective section. Click it again to close the code.

## About the Data {.tabset}

This section lists and explains the data sets used for each VTC population in the IR Report Samples tab section.

### Data Sources

The primary sources for the project are the following public reports:

-   [2020-2021 Vermont Tech Course Catalog](https://www.vtc.edu/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2021-Catalog.pdf)

-   [Vermont State Colleges (VSC) Financial Statements](https://www.vsc.edu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/6-30-21-Financial-Statements-FINAL.pdf) 2019-2021

-   [National Center for Education Statistics](https://www.nces.ed.gov/ipeds/use-the-data/)

### Students {.tabset}

#### Student Population Counts

VTC full-time student population totals for the student data set derive from a published chart on page 13 in the [2020-2021 VSC Financial Statement](https://www.vsc.edu/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/6-30-21-Financial-Statements-FINAL.pdf).

![](Inkedvtc2020_LI.jpg){width="500"}

According to the VSC chart, there should be 7,051 un-duplicated full-time student observations between 2019 and 2020 in the data set. To see how the data set was created, click the `CODE` button on the right. Click it again to close.

```{r, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)

# Make the VTC FTE student vectors (1 column with 1313 rows and so on)



vtc_2020<-rep("vtc_2020", 1313) #2020 FTE VTC Students = 1313
vtc_2019<-rep("vtc_2019", 1573) #2019 FTE VTC Students = 1573
vtc_2018<-rep("vtc_2018", 1533) #2018 FTE VTC Students = 1533
vtc_2017<-rep("vtc_2017", 1297) #2017 FTE VTC Students = 1297
vtc_2016<-rep("vtc_2016", 1335) #2019 FTE VTC Students = 1335

# Bind the column vectors together

vtc_students <- c(vtc_2016, vtc_2017, vtc_2018, vtc_2019, vtc_2020)

# Make the dataframe - 1 column with all the years

vtc_students <- as.data.frame(vtc_students)


# Separate the vtc descriptor and year into separate columns

vtc_students <-
  vtc_students %>% 
  separate(col = vtc_students,
           into = c("school", "enrollment_year"),
           sep = "_",
           remove = FALSE)




```

Make a rudimentary table to verify VSC Financial Statement and R population counts match.

```{r}
knitr::kable(table(vtc_students$enrollment_year))
```

#### Student Demographics

Student demographics data from 2019-2020 derive from [National Center for Education Statistics IPEDS data center](https://nces.ed.gov/ipeds/datacenter/) queries. Summary query results like those in the figure from the 2020 query below represent the demographic data in the vtc_student data set. Table 1 represents race population percentages reported to NCES by VTC. Click on the `CODE` button on the right to see how the same demographic variables in R are created.

![](summary_query.JPG)

|          |                 |       |       |          |                    |         |       |
|:--------|:-------:|:-------:|:-------:|:-------:|:-------:|:-------:|:-------:|
| Year     | 2 or More Races | Asian | Black | Hispanic | Non-Resident Alien | Unknown | White |
| 2020[^1] |      0.04       | 0.02  | 0.03  |   0.03   |        0.02        |  0.03   | 0.84  |
| 2019     |      0.03       | 0.02  | 0.03  |   0.02   |        0.02        |  0.02   | 0.86  |
| 2018[^2] |      0.17       | 0.01  | 0.02  |   0.02   |        0.02        |  0.03   | 0.74  |
| 2017[^3] |      0.04       | 0.02  | 0.01  |   0.03   |        0.02        |  0.02   | 0.85  |
| 2016[^4] |      0.03       | 0.02  | 0.01  |   0.02   |        0.03        |  0.02   | 0.87  |

: Table 1 - VTC race data 2019-2020 by percent of population, Source: National Center for Education Statistics - IPEDS Data Center

[^1]: 2020 Undergraduate population race distribution total (as reported) = 101%

[^2]: 2018 Undergraduate population race distribution total (as reported) = 101%

[^3]: 2017 Undergraduate population race distribution total (as reported) = 99%

[^4]: 2016 Undergraduate population race distribution total (as reported) = 101%

```{r, collapse=TRUE}
# Create the race column

vtc_students$race <- "race"

# Separate the data sets into years

vtc_2016 <- subset(vtc_students, enrollment_year == "2016")
vtc_2017 <- subset(vtc_students, enrollment_year == "2017")
vtc_2018 <- subset(vtc_students, enrollment_year == "2018")
vtc_2019 <- subset(vtc_students, enrollment_year == "2019")
vtc_2020 <- subset(vtc_students, enrollment_year == "2020")


# Calculate average student race by year (using Table 1 data)

# 2 or More Races

(.04+.03+.17+.04+.03)/5 # = 0.06

# Asian

(.02+.02+.01+.02+.02)/5 # = 0.02

# Black

(.03+.03+.02+.01+.01)/5 # = 0.02

# Hispanic

(.03+.02+.02+.03+.02)/5 # = 0.02

# Non-Resident Alien

(.02+.02+.02+.02+.03)/5 # = 0.02

# Unknown

(.03+.02+.03+.02+.02)/5 # = 0.02

# White

(.84+.86+.74+.85+.87)/5 # = 0.83



```

| Race               | Average Population Rate |
|:-------------------|:-----------------------:|
| 2 or More Races    |          0.06           |
| Asian              |          0.02           |
| Black              |          0.02           |
| Hispanic           |          0.02           |
| Non-Resident Alien |          0.02           |
| Unknown            |          0.02           |
| White              |          0.83           |

hispanic_16<-rep("hispanic", 26)

vtc_2016$race <-race16

Now bring the data sets back together and plot the results

```{r}

library(reshape)

vtc_list <- list(vtc_2016, vtc_2017, vtc_2018, vtc_2019, vtc_2020)

vtc_students_2 <-merge_recurse(vtc_list)

knitr::kable(table(vtc_students_2$enrollment_year, vtc_students_2$race))


```
